translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Chatta
“In the past I was a chariot-maker,
and gave it to the Kinsman of the Sun.
this is the fruit of the plank.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the plank.
four times as a creator god;
… the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Phalakadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā phalakadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Phalakadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā phalakadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽phalakadāyaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Phalakadāyaka’s Birth Story, the eighth.
